revised_title: Investigations into the Non-Vascularity and Nutrition of Certain Animal Tissues
tldr: The author examines the non-vascular nature and unique mode of organization and nutrition in various animal tissues, such as articular cartilage, fibro-cartilage, cornea, crystalline lens, and vitreous humour. He demonstrates that these tissues are nourished by a nutrient fluid that exudes from the surrounding blood vessels and is circulated by the vital properties of the cells within these tissues.
